Hello everyone! How are you? The Greater Ohio Virtual School is still operating during this pandemic. In fact, our students are still completing lessons and earning their required weekly hours! Also, since we are the pre-eminent virtual school in Ohio, we are fielding a ton of information requests from other schools on how to educate students virtually.

We drew our winners to the March performance raffle (students have to complete at least 1 lesson a day & earn at least 25 hours a week for the entire month), plus two students who had the highest % increase in both categories.

Congrats to:
Gavin Jacob, Kiara Allgood, Jaclyn Cable, and Morgan Bowman!

Special Congrats to our two students who increased their % in both categories: William Honeycutt (for % increase in lessons) and Lucinda Lopez-Perez (for % increase in hours)!

On Monday, June 10, 2019, the Greater Ohio Virtual School held its annual graduation ceremony at the Urbancrest Baptist Church in Lebanon. This year, 146 Greater Ohio Virtual School students met the requirements for graduation and earned their high school diplomas. This is the highest number of graduating seniors in the history of Greater Ohio Virtual School.

With continued enrollment growth each year, GOVS will continue to partner with local school districts to provide hundreds of students with an opportunity to be successful in a non-traditional classroom while working to obtain their diploma.

If you'd like to view the entire slideshow of pictures, please click the link at the bottom of this post.

Congratulations to the Class of 2019!

https://www.mygovs.com/DistrictGallery.aspx?CategoryId=314&schoolid=0

Tutoring is now available for 2018-2019!

GREATER OHIO VIRTUAL SCHOOL TUTORING PROGRAM:

Tutoring is available at no charge by request from students and/or parents. Tutoring is available through remote tutoring using Google Hangout or face-to-face tutoring in the GOVS offices or a public space such as a library. Tutoring is limited to 5 hours per student per week. Anything above 5 hours per student per week requires approval from the director of GOVS. If you would like a tutor, please visit our website at www.mygovs.com and click on the Tutor Request link up top. It will take you to a Google form where you can request tutoring. Please note: a parent must sign you up for tutoring unless you are 18 and on your own. If you have any questions, please email Mr. Chuck Merk, GOVS Outreach Coordinator, at chuck.merk@mygovs.com.

A new Work Study program has been implemented at the Greater Ohio Virtual School. Students who are working a full or part time job can now receive elective credit for that job along with hours that can be counted toward their weekly attendance totals. Former GOVS Intervention Specialist, Melody Goodwin, has been hired to monitor the program and work with each student. She will be responsible for collecting paystubs as proof of hours worked along with communicating with each students employer to assure the student is working and functioning in a positive manner in the workplace. With nearly 70% of the Greater Ohio Virtual School student population working a job, a Work Study Program was an obvious way to help those students earn additional credit on their way to earning their degree. If you are would like to sign up for the program you can contact the main office or click on the link below for more information!

Time Spent Today calculator added to Student Home Page!

In an effort to help students keep track of the new five-hour log in requirement, we have added a helpful calculator to each student homepage. As a reminder, each student is required to log in and work on his or her classes for a total of five hours per day. Located near the top of the page, you can now find a Time Spent Today icon that will display the total number of accumulated hours and minutes. Again, this doesnt have to be 5 consecutive hours per day, as it will automatically keep track and add hours and minutes each time the student logs on and completes work throughout the day. Additionally, we would like to remind all students to save their progress as they are working, as the program will automatically log students out after 90 minutes of inactivity. Please remember that this five-hour log in requirement is very important to the funding of our school now and in the future!

Greater Ohio Virtual School is NCAA approved! Our core courses now count toward the initial eligibility standards for athletes planning to play Division I and II college sports. State legislation allows virtual school students the opportunity to participate in extracurricular activities in their districts of residence. GOVS students must meet the same academic and financial requirements as any other student participating in the activity, but have the ability to play the sport of their choice through high school and into college. This opens the door for scholarship opportunities at Division I and II schools! Talk to a school counselor for more information.
